page.title: 06The Maritime Museum
page.content: {The Headland-H/pool By Alan Watt There is a Maritime Museum on the top floor of Northgate Library.We went to visit the Museum,which was opened in 1971.In the entrance hall there is a mosaic floor showing the H/pool coat of arms.There are old paintings on the walls as you go upstairs.One of the paintings is of the time when the Germans shelled H/pool{(Bombardment).} Inside the Museum there are cases full of things about the sea.There is an old cottage with a hole-in-the-wall bed and an old-fashioned fire place. There is a big old document from the shipyard of William Gray showing the names of the first 1000 ships which they built when Hartlepool was a ship-building town.The date on the wall outside the library is 1903-1904.
